Lack of credible sources: The expert points out that the articles making the claim did not provide any links or citations to support their information. This lack of credible sources raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Use of unrelated image: The expert mentions that the image featured in the articles was taken from a June 2017 news report about a different incident in Jackson, Mississippi. This discrepancy suggests that the image was used misleadingly to support the false claim.
Inconsistencies with genuine news report: The expert states that genuine news reports about the incident made no mention of the body being found on a judge's doorstep or the victim being a pedophile. These inconsistencies with verified information further cast doubt on the authenticity of the claim.
Imaginings of a fake news writer: The expert concludes that the claims of the body being found on a judge's doorstep and the victim being a pedophile are simply the imaginings of a fake news writer. This assessment highlights the lack of credibility and reliability in the claim.
